study_plan_entry.title: Modelling magnetic and spectroscopy properties of molecules containing d- and f- elements

free_text.Learning outcomes: Introduction to user-friendly computational tools for the calculation of magnetic and spectroscopic properties of metal complexes (d- & f-block). Review of basic theory. Bring the students up to date with modern applied quantum chemistry. Study of practical projects. Applied sample calculations. Hands on exercises for graduate students.
free_text.Content: [li]Relativistic effects[br/][li]Energy levels in free metal-ions: multiplets, spin-orbit coupling, Zeeman and hyperfine coupling[br/][li]Symmetry and wave functions: Full rotation group, molecular point groups, double groups.[br/][li]Energy levels in metal complexes I: Ligandfield theory, spin-orbit coupling.[br/][li]Energy levels in metal complexes II: Density Functional Theory, Pauli-relativistic calculations, Zero Order Regularisation Approximation.[br/][li]Modelling molecular magnetism: non-empirical calculation of Heisenberg-VanVleck-Dirac hamiltonian parameters, modeling spin-dependant (double) exchange.[br/][li]First principle calculation of the NMR spin Hamiltonian parameters including nuclear Zeeman, Shielding tensor and spin-spin coupling.[br/][li]First principle calculation of the EPR spin Hamiltonian parameters including Zeeman, hyperfine, Zero Field Splitting and Electric Field Gradients[br/][li]Etc...
free_text.Keywords: DFT, Molecular Magnetism, EPR parameters, NMR parameters, open d-shells, open f-shells, excited states
free_text.Note: This course will be given in Spring 2011.
